00014 #ifndef ATOMIC_SMART_PTR_H_
00015 #define ATOMIC_SMART_PTR_H_

00017 #include <atomic.h>
00018 
00019 //! This is an atomic variant of boost::scoped_ptr<>.
00020 //! atomic_scoped_ptr<> can be shared among threads by the use of swap() as the argument.
00021 //! That is, a destructive read. Use atomic_shared_ptr<> for non-destructive reading.
00022 //! The implementation relies on an atimic-swap machine code, e.g. lock xchg.
00023 //! \sa atomic_shared_ptr
00024 template <typename T>
00025 class atomic_scoped_ptr
00026 {
00027     typedef T* t_ptr;
00028 public:
00029     atomic_scoped_ptr() : m_ptr(0) {
00030     }
00031 
00032     explicit atomic_scoped_ptr(t_ptr t) : m_ptr(t) {
00033         writeBarrier();
00034     }
00035 
00036     ~atomic_scoped_ptr() { readBarrier(); delete m_ptr;}
00037 
00038     void reset(t_ptr t = 0) {
00039         writeBarrier();
00040         t_ptr old = atomicSwap(t, &m_ptr);
00041         readBarrier();
00042         delete old;
00043     }
00044     //! \param x \p x is atomically swapped.
00045     //! Nevertheless, this object is not atomically replaced. 
00046     //! That is, the object pointed by "this" must not be shared among threads.
00047     void swap(atomic_scoped_ptr &x) {
00048         writeBarrier();
00049         m_ptr = atomicSwap(m_ptr, &x.m_ptr);
00050         readBarrier();
00051     }
00052 
00053     //! These functions must be called while writing is blocked.
00054     T &operator*() const { ASSERT(m_ptr); return (T&)*m_ptr;}
00055 
00056     t_ptr operator->() const { ASSERT(m_ptr); return (t_ptr)m_ptr;}
00057 
00058     t_ptr get() const {
00059         return (t_ptr )m_ptr;
00060     }
00061 private:
00062     atomic_scoped_ptr(const atomic_scoped_ptr &) {}
00063     atomic_scoped_ptr& operator=(const atomic_scoped_ptr &) {return *this;}
00064 
00065     t_ptr m_ptr;
00066 };
00067 
00068 //! Instance of Ref is only one per one object.
00069 template <typename T>
00070 struct atomic_shared_ptr_ref {
00071     template <class Y>
00072     atomic_shared_ptr_ref(Y *p) : ptr(p), refcnt(1) {}
00073     ~atomic_shared_ptr_ref() { ASSERT(refcnt == 0); delete ptr; }
00074     T *ptr;
00075     //! Global reference counter.
00076     unsigned int refcnt;
00077 };
00078 
00079 
00080 //! This is an atomic variant of boost::shared_ptr<>.
00081 //! atomic_shared_ptr<> can be shared among threads by the use of operator=(), swap() as the argument.
00082 //! The implementation relies on a DCAS (Double Compare and Set) machine code, e.g. cmpxchg8b.
00083 //! \sa atomic_scoped_ptr
00084 template <typename T>
00085 class atomic_shared_ptr
00086 {
00087 public:
00088     typedef atomic_shared_ptr_ref<T> Ref;
00089 
00090     atomic_shared_ptr() {
00091         m_ref.pref = 0;
00092         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = 0;
00093     }
00094 
00095     template<typename Y> explicit atomic_shared_ptr(Y *y) {
00096         m_ref.pref = new Ref(y);
00097         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = 0;
00098         writeBarrier();
00099     }
00100 
00101     atomic_shared_ptr(const atomic_shared_ptr &t) {
00102         m_ref.pref = t._scan_();
00103         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = 0;
00104     }
00105     template<typename Y> atomic_shared_ptr(const atomic_shared_ptr<Y> &y) {
00106         m_ref.pref = (typename atomic_shared_ptr::Ref*)y._scan_();
00107         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = 0;
00108     }
00109 
00110     ~atomic_shared_ptr();
00111 
00112     //! \param t This object is atomically replaced with \a t.
00113     atomic_shared_ptr &operator=(const atomic_shared_ptr &t) {
00114         atomic_shared_ptr(t).swap(*this);
00115         return *this;
00116     }
00117     //! \param y This object is atomically replaced with \a t.
00118     template<typename Y> atomic_shared_ptr &operator=(const atomic_shared_ptr<Y> &y) {
00119         atomic_shared_ptr(y).swap(*this);
00120         return *this;
00121     }
00122     //! This object is atomically reset.
00123     void reset() {
00124         atomic_shared_ptr().swap(*this);
00125     }
00126     //! \param y This object is atomically reset with a pointer \a y.
00127     template<typename Y> void reset(Y *y) {
00128         atomic_shared_ptr(y).swap(*this);
00129     }
00130 
00131     //! \param x \p x is atomically swapped.
00132     //! Nevertheless, this object is not atomically replaced. 
00133     //! That is, the object pointed by "this" must not be shared among threads.
00134     void swap(atomic_shared_ptr &);
00135 
00136     //! \return true if succeeded.
00137     bool compareAndSwap(const atomic_shared_ptr &oldr, atomic_shared_ptr &r);
00138 
00139     //! These functions must be called while writing is blocked.
00140     T *get() const { return m_ref.pref ? m_ref.pref->ptr : 0L; }
00141 
00142     T &operator*() const { ASSERT(*this); return *get();}
00143 
00144     T *operator->() const { ASSERT(*this); return get();}
00145 
00146     bool operator!() const {return !m_ref.pref;}
00147     operator bool() const {return m_ref.pref;}    
00148 
00149 private:
00150     typedef uint16_t Serial;
00151     typedef uint_cas2_each RefcntNSerial;
00152     static inline uint_cas2_each _refcnt(RefcntNSerial x) {return x / (1uL << 8 * sizeof(uint16_t));}
00153     static inline Serial _serial(RefcntNSerial x) {return x % (1uL << 8 * sizeof(uint16_t));}
00154     static inline RefcntNSerial _combine(uint_cas2_each ref, Serial serial) {
00155         return ref * (1uL << 8 * sizeof(uint16_t)) + (serial % (1uL << 8 * sizeof(uint16_t)));
00156     }
00157 public:
00158     //! internal functions below.
00159     //! atomically scan \a Ref and increase global reference counter.
00160     Ref *_scan_() const;
00161     //! atomically scan \a Ref and increase local reference counter.
00162     Ref *_reserve_scan_(RefcntNSerial *) const;    
00163     //! try to decrease local reference counter.
00164     void _leave_scan_(Ref *, Serial serial) const;    
00165 private:
00166     struct _RefLocal {
00167         //! A pointer to global reference struct.
00168         Ref* pref;
00169         //! Local reference counter w/ serial number for ABA problem.
00170         RefcntNSerial refcnt_n_serial;
00171     };
00172     mutable _RefLocal m_ref;
00173 };
00174 
00175 template <typename T>
00176 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::~atomic_shared_ptr() {
00177     readBarrier();
00178     ASSERT(_refcnt(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial) == 0);
00179     Ref *pref = m_ref.pref;
00180     if(!pref) return;
00181     if(atomicDecAndTest(&pref->refcnt)) {
00182         readBarrier();
00183         delete pref;
00184     }
00185 }
00186 
00187 template <typename T>
00188 typename atomic_shared_ptr<T>::Ref *atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_scan_() const {
00189     RefcntNSerial rs;
00190     Ref *pref = _reserve_scan_(&rs);
00191     if(!pref) return 0;
00192     atomicInc(&pref->refcnt);
00193     _leave_scan_(pref, _serial(rs));
00194     return pref;
00195 }
00196 
00197 template <typename T>
00198 typename atomic_shared_ptr<T>::Ref *
00199 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_reserve_scan_(RefcntNSerial *rs) const {
00200     Ref *pref;
00201     RefcntNSerial rs_new;
00202     for(;;) {
00203         pref = m_ref.pref;
00204         RefcntNSerial rs_old;
00205         rs_old = m_ref.refcnt_n_serial;
00206         if(!pref) {
00207             // target is null.
00208             *rs = rs_old;
00209             return 0;
00210         }
00211         rs_new = _combine(_refcnt(rs_old) + 1, _serial(rs_old));
00212         // try to increase local reference counter w/ same serial.
00213         if(atomicCompareAndSet2(
00214             (unsigned int)pref, rs_old,
00215             (unsigned int)pref, rs_new,
00216             (unsigned int*)&m_ref))
00217             break;
00218     }
00219     *rs = rs_new;
00220     return pref;
00221 }
00222 template <typename T>
00223 void
00224 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_leave_scan_(Ref *pref, Serial serial) const {
00225     for(;;) {
00226         RefcntNSerial rs_old;
00227         rs_old = _combine(_refcnt(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial), serial);
00228         RefcntNSerial rs_new = _combine(_refcnt(rs_old) - 1, _serial(rs_old));
00229         // try to dec. reference counter and change serial if stored pointer is unchanged.
00230         if(atomicCompareAndSet2(
00231             (unsigned int)pref, rs_old,
00232             (unsigned int)pref, rs_new,
00233             (unsigned int*)&m_ref))
00234             break;
00235         if((pref != m_ref.pref) || (serial != _serial(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial))) {
00236             // local reference of this context has released by other processes.
00237             if(atomicDecAndTest((int*)&pref->refcnt)) {
00238                 readBarrier();
00239                 delete pref;
00240             }
00241             break;
00242         }
00243     }
00244 }
00245 
00246 template <typename T>
00247 void
00248 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::swap(atomic_shared_ptr<T> &r) {
00249     Ref *pref;
00250     T *oldptr = 0;
00251     if(m_ref.pref) {
00252         // Release local reference.
00253         unsigned int refcnt = _refcnt(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial);
00254         if(refcnt)
00255             atomicAdd(&m_ref.pref->refcnt, refcnt);
00256         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = _combine(0, _serial(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial) + 1);
00257         oldptr = m_ref.pref->ptr;
00258     }
00259     else
00260         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = _combine(0, _serial(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial));
00261     writeBarrier();
00262     for(;;) {
00263         RefcntNSerial rs_old, rs_new;
00264         pref = r._reserve_scan_(&rs_old);
00265         if(pref) {
00266             ASSERT(_refcnt(rs_old));
00267             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, (unsigned int)(_refcnt(rs_old) - 1));
00268         }
00269         rs_new = _combine(0, _refcnt(rs_old) + 1);
00270         if(atomicCompareAndSet2(
00271             (unsigned int)pref, rs_old,
00272             (unsigned int)m_ref.pref, rs_new,
00273             (unsigned int*)&r.m_ref))
00274             break;
00275         if(pref) {
00276             ASSERT(_refcnt(rs_old));
00277             atomicAdd((int*)&pref->refcnt, - (int)(_refcnt(rs_old) - 1));
00278             r._leave_scan_(pref, _serial(rs_old));
00279         }
00280     }
00281     m_ref.pref = pref;
00282 }
00283 
00284 template <typename T>
00285 bool
00286 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::compareAndSwap(const atomic_shared_ptr<T> &oldr, atomic_shared_ptr<T> &r) {
00287     Ref *pref;
00288     T *oldptr = 0;
00289     if(m_ref.pref) {
00290         unsigned int refcnt = _refcnt(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial);
00291         // Release local reference.
00292         if(refcnt)
00293             atomicAdd(&m_ref.pref->refcnt, refcnt);
00294         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = _combine(0, _serial(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial) + 1);
00295         oldptr = m_ref.pref->ptr;
00296     }
00297     else
00298         m_ref.refcnt_n_serial = _combine(0, _serial(m_ref.refcnt_n_serial));
00299     writeBarrier();
00300     for(;;) {
00301         RefcntNSerial rs_old, rs_new;
00302         pref = r._reserve_scan_(&rs_old);
00303         if(pref != oldr.m_ref.pref) {
00304             if(pref)
00305                 r._leave_scan_(pref, _serial(rs_old));
00306             return false;
00307         }
00308         if(pref) {
00309             ASSERT(_refcnt(rs_old));
00310             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, (unsigned int)(_refcnt(rs_old)- 1));
00311         }
00312         rs_new = _combine(0, _refcnt(rs_old) + 1);
00313         if(atomicCompareAndSet2(
00314             (unsigned int)pref, rs_old,
00315             (unsigned int)m_ref.pref, rs_new,
00316             (unsigned int*)&r.m_ref))
00317             break;
00318         if(pref) {
00319             ASSERT(_refcnt(rs_old));
00320             atomicAdd((int*)&pref->refcnt, - (int)(_refcnt(rs_old)- 1));
00321             r._leave_scan_(pref, _serial(rs_old));
00322         }
00323     }
00324     m_ref.pref = pref;
00325     return true;
00326 }
00327 
00328 template <typename T, class Enable>
00329 class atomic
00330 {
00331 public:
00332     atomic() : m_var(new T) {}
00333     atomic(T t) : m_var(new T(t)) {}
00334     atomic(const atomic &t) : m_var(t) {}
00335     ~atomic() {}
00336     operator T() const {
00337         atomic_shared_ptr<T> x = m_var;
00338         return *x;
00339     }
00340     atomic &operator=(T t) {
00341         m_var.reset(new T(t));
00342         return *this;
00343     }
00344     T swap(T newv) {
00345         atomic_shared_ptr<T> x(newv);
00346         x.swap(m_var);
00347         return *x;
00348     }
00349 protected:
00350     atomic_shared_ptr<T> m_var;
00351 };
